citations.narrative:
It has been over 12 months since at least 35 adult dogs have had a complete physical examination by the attending
veterinarian. The last examination by the veterinarian for some dogs was on 4/6/2023, some on 4/14/2023, some on
4/21/2023 and some on 5/26/2023.
Physical examinations by the attending veterinarian are important to evaluate the overall health and physical body
condition of the dogs in the facility. In addition, physical exams give the attending veterinarian important information about
the dog’s health and helps to catch potential health issues before they become problems. All dogs must have a complete
head to tail physical examination by the attending veterinarian that occurs not less than once every 12 months. Correct by
8/22/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
It has been over 12 months since at least 35 adult dogs have had a complete physical examination by the attending 
veterinarian. The last examination by the veterinarian for some dogs was on 4/6/2023, some on 4/14/2023, some on 
4/21/2023 and some on 5/26/2023. 
Physical examinations by the attending veterinarian are important to evaluate the overall health and physical body 
condition of the dogs in the facility. In addition, physical exams give the attending veterinarian important information about 
the dog’s health and helps to catch potential health issues before they become problems. All dogs must have a complete 
head to tail physical examination by the attending veterinarian that occurs not less than once every 12 months. Correct by 
8/22/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
